questions.question: In the Hall Effect experiment, what is the primary mechanism responsible for the generation of the Hall voltage?

answers.a: The magnetic field inducing an electric current in the conductor
answers.b: The Hall sensor measuring the magnetic field strength
answers.c: The Lorentz force deflecting the charge carriers’ perpendicular to both the current and the magnetic field
answers.d: The charge separation caused by the Lorentz force, creating a potential difference across the conductor

questions.question: Which of the following parameters affects the magnitude of the Hall voltage in the Hall Effect experiment?
What is the relationship between the Hall voltage and the magnetic field direction in the Hall effect experiment?

answers.a: The Hall voltage is in the same direction as the magnetic field.
answers.b: The Hall voltage is perpendicular to both the current and the magnetic field.
answers.c: The Hall voltage is opposite to the magnetic field direction.
answers.d: The Hall voltage is parallel to the current direction.

questions.question: Which of the following materials would be most suitable for observing a strong Hall effect?

answers.c: A semiconductor with low carrier density
answers.d: A semiconductor with high carrier density

questions.question: In the Hall effect experiment, what is the role of the magnetic field?

answers.a: To induce electric currents in the conductor
answers.b: To create a potential difference across the conductor
answers.c: To provide a force to deflect the charge carriers
answers.d: To measure the temperature of the conductor
